name: MadTracker Instrument
summary: Learn about .MTI files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Musicians and producers use MTI files to save and reuse custom instruments in their compositions. This allows for consistent sound across different projects without reloading or adjusting settings manually each time.

While MadTracker was widely used in the early 2000s, its popularity has declined, and modern digital audio workstations (DAWs) now offer more advanced instrument formats. However, those working with older projects or exploring tracker-based music production may still use MTI files.
NOTE: Yannick Delwiche developed MadTracker but no longer updates the software.

description: An MTI file is an instrument used by MadTracker, a music tracker software for Windows. It contains information about an instrument that can be played back within MadTracker using MIDI data (maps notes to the instruments to play them). MTI files include samples, envelope settings, volume levels, panning, pitch modulation, and other parameters that define how it sounds when triggered by notes in a MadTracker project.

instructions: You can open MTI files with MadTracker and FMJ-Software Awave Studio in Windows. For example, you can open an MTI file via the Instrument Panel in MadTracker by right-clicking an empty instrument slot in the Instrument List and selecting Load Instrument... from the menu.
